Title: Sinai Arabic 457. Varia: manuscript, [10th c.] St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai, Egypt
Contents note: Apophthegmata. Homilies and Mimars derived from SS. Peter Patriarch of Alexandria, Martius, Epiphanius, Amphilochius Bishop of Iconium, Kyrkos Patriarch of Antioch, Cyril Patriarch of Jerusalem and John Chrysostom. Martyrdom of SS. Ignatius second Patriarch of Antioch, Shabub and his six companions, Andrianus and his wife Anatolia, Eusebia, Victor, Staphinia, and Paphnutius. St. Basil’s miracles recounted by Aladius Bishop of Caesarea. Story of Thecla who was engaged to Thamyris and then became a pupil to St. Paul
Condition note: parchment brittle and broken edges but manuscript opens easily
